name: Ground down drossy 3mm deep with cupping stone
The prepared surface was thoroughly cleaned using a blower to remove dust
Surface cleaned with water and a brush to eliminate any contaminants that could hinder the bonding process.
The surface was brought to a saturated surface dry (SSD) condition, ensuring it was fully saturated but free of standing water before applying the product.

Equal proportions of resin (Part A) and hardener (Part B) were mixed on a clean board using a spatula or steel trowel. The mixture was blended thoroughly until achieving a uniform, streak-free grey colour

The mixed epoxy was applied to the prepared surface using a spatula or trowel, ensuring it was thoroughly worked into the substrate for maximum adhesion. The surface was then finished with a steel float or trowel to achieve the desired finish.
